```markdown
# trim-lines

Remove spaces and tabs around line breaks.

[![Build Status][build-badge]][build]
[![Coverage][coverage-badge]][coverage]
[![Downloads][downloads-badge]][downloads]
[![Size][size-badge]][size]

This package is a tiny utility that removes spaces and tabs around line endings,
keeping the line endings, and not removing whitespace at the start or end of the
string.  While seemingly trivial, achieving performance is crucial.


## Contents

* [What is this?](#what-is-this)
* [When should I use this?](#when-should-i-use-this)
* [Install](#install)
* [Use](#use)

    * [`trimLines(value)`](#trimlinesvalue)

## What is this?

This package provides a function to efficiently remove spaces and tabs immediately surrounding newline characters in a string, preserving leading/trailing whitespace.


## When should I use this?

Use this package when you need to clean up whitespace around line breaks, especially in text formats like Markdown, without compromising performance.


## Install

This package is ESM only.

**Node.js (14.14+, 16.0+, or 18.0+):**

```bash
npm install trim-lines
```

**Deno:**

```typescript
import trimLines from 'https://esm.sh/trim-lines@3';
```

**Browsers (using ESM.sh):**

```html
<script type="module">
  import trimLines from 'https://esm.sh/trim-lines@3?bundle';
  // Use trimLines here
</script>
```


## Use

```javascript
import { trimLines } from 'trim-lines';

console.log(trimLines(' foo\t\n\n bar \n\tbaz ')); // Output: ' foo\n\nbar\nbaz '
```


## API

This package exports the function `trimLines`.

### `trimLines(value)`

Removes spaces and tabs around line breaks in the input string.

*   **value**: The input string to trim.


## Types

This package uses TypeScript for type definitions.  No additional types are exported.


## Compatibility

This package is compatible with modern Node.js versions (14.14+, 16.0+, and 18.0+). It also works in Deno and modern browsers.
